reviews.text: bello
A beautiful square composed by many wonderful gothic buildings!!!
Yes, one of those places with pillars where you can whisper in one corner and it will be heard at one on the opposite side... Place with lots of history.
Nice place to chill
Wow
This was a meet up spot for our group got some cool photos and it was near some local shops
Marvelous sculpture! Go see it and study itin its perfection
It has been renovated recently. Impressive!

Beautiful Christmas night at the Neptune fountain decorated by this giant tree, they even tried to give the tree natural touch...
And also new year's eve...
Convenient meeting point with some kinky mermaids.
I love it there's too much to see a lot to admire
I really liked it. I and my wife were delighted with this place.
Interesting building with impressive brickwork, loved the local market nearby
It was a fun experience.
Interesting building and the council room was especially beautiful.

worth the trip to see the anatomical theater. walls and ceiling that line the entire building are tattooed with text and painted seals. chaotic and extraordinary. you can view the library from an adjoining hall, but it was gated off on our visit. would go back to schedule a tour of the library if that is at all possible.

It used to be a building of the Bologna university. It is very beautiful one, with nice halls, decorated ceilings, wooden statutes and a lot of very very old books. 
The library is an active one so it is closed to visitors. A visit to the famous halls cousts 3 euro's, no discounts. A short stroll in the corridors can be done for free but I definitely think the halls are worth a visit.
Wow. A must visit when you're in Bologna. It was so interesting to see history of universities. Very nice time and cheap (€3).
Great place to visit if you are in Bologna. Lots of history and great architecture. Really worth  a visit.

Not very expensive (only 3 euros) and it had a lot of history to it. But I wouldn't say that it has a lot going on. There was an A4 info sheet available in several langauges but once you've read that and then looked at lots of pictures and articles written in Italian you're done with the place. The most impressive thing is the anatomy theatre itself (The architecture) and I'm not sure it's with the entry fee.

The place, if you dare to climb, where the whole town reveal in full glory. 360 degree view on Bologna. Definitely worthy to visit, and to climb. Book online in advance or buy tickets from the info center. There is a time schedule and access is on every 45 minutes.

Unusual towers! Even in bad wet weather, they create an unrivaled atmosphere! In Christmas, there is a very special atmosphere here! The whole of Bologna becomes brighter and highlights its rich historical past! I recommend this colorful city. Be sure to settle in the tower or go look at the center of Bologna!

when you want to visit Asinelli tower, necessary to buy tickets at Tourist office and to book your time in advance, because it is limited access to tower. 
After your great efforts - you get your compensation - wonderful panorama over Bologna!
Pretty long climbing til the top, better to choose a sunny day cause the view is amazing from the terrace on the top

The walk up is very claustrophobic. 

Views are good but if you are short on time in Bologna you can skip this.

The railings aren't helpful for photos.
Super
Un'altra bellissima torre di Bologna meno importante di quella degli asinelli ma sempre bella e affascinante
Bellissima torre anche questa. Meno imponente di quella degli asinelli, ma non per questo meno bella
Torre medievale bellissima della Manhattan del dodicesimo secolo, Bologna. Meriterebbe più interesse.
Un altra bellissima torre delle città di bologna situata in via altabella, non molto sponsorizzata ma unica.

Very lovely place. Good for those who want to propose for their partner in life. A very high place with a nice scenery. Highly recommended for field trip, excursion, and training area for marathon and cycling. Your stay here is worth the time you spend going up the n this high place. So if I were you I will visit this place A.S.A.P.

Beautiful church on a hill. Definitely recommend taking the portico all the way up, it will make for a very memorable experience. The view of the countryside is gorgeous. The orange building contrasts beautifully with the green fields. If you came up via the portico, go down the other way for a nice view of the church from the other side. If you want an even better panorama, pay 5 euros and climb the tiny staircase to the viewing point. It won't disappoint.

A great place for exercise at any time of the year. The walk is quite steep, so you should be comfortable with walking uphill for at least 30 minutes. The top has a beautiful church, a terrace with great views, a gift shop, and an opportunity to see the city from the tip top. A must visit while in Bologna for fit travelers.

A nice church to go and visit. A very long and steep walk from the town centre. Although quite a few bugs crawling about outside so be careful where you sit!
You can get a touristy bus ride up there from the main square. However getting back on it for the ride down is a bit of a bun fight. A nice walk back down on a sunny day and jump on a normal bus back to town.
Breathe taking place to visit when coming to Bologna. Cycling or walking up by taking San Luca climb to respect the place is recommended. A must visit place.

Very lovely place. Good for those who want to propose for their partner in life. A very high place with a nice scenery. Highly recommended for field trip, excursion, and training area for marathon and cycling. Your stay here is worth the time you spend going up the n this high place. So if I were you I will visit this place A.S.A.P.

Beautiful church on a hill. Definitely recommend taking the portico all the way up, it will make for a very memorable experience. The view of the countryside is gorgeous. The orange building contrasts beautifully with the green fields. If you came up via the portico, go down the other way for a nice view of the church from the other side. If you want an even better panorama, pay 5 euros and climb the tiny staircase to the viewing point. It won't disappoint.

A great place for exercise at any time of the year. The walk is quite steep, so you should be comfortable with walking uphill for at least 30 minutes. The top has a beautiful church, a terrace with great views, a gift shop, and an opportunity to see the city from the tip top. A must visit while in Bologna for fit travelers.

A nice church to go and visit. A very long and steep walk from the town centre. Although quite a few bugs crawling about outside so be careful where you sit!
You can get a touristy bus ride up there from the main square. However getting back on it for the ride down is a bit of a bun fight. A nice walk back down on a sunny day and jump on a normal bus back to town.
Breathe taking place to visit when coming to Bologna. Cycling or walking up by taking San Luca climb to respect the place is recommended. A must visit place.

I really enjoyed the Japanese woodblock exhibition although I found the recorder guide difficult to match with the numbering system.
I returned two days later to visit the rest of the museum and had a really interesting time.
The most dead animals and bones I have ever witnessed in one place.  It made me realize how strange the creatures must have seemed when returned to Bologna by the explorers

We found an interesting gallery that period. Otherwise the museum is not so good for the money we paid .12 euro the ticket for students I think. I would recommend it only if you don't have other things to do in Bologna.
Enriching experience satisfing both families, students and researcher s.
Awesome Musuem in Bologna, it's a must to see. There are usually temporary exposition.
Interesting history and the workers were kind. Buddha museum wasn't English friendly though. Was pleasant.
The museum is nice, worth the price. The visit is around 1,5-2 hours. Unfortunately, half of the staff is pretty rude (one of them tried to kick us out 20 minutes before closing).

Cool place. 5 stars. I would definitely recommend this experience to anyone who is in town and has a few hours to pass. It is easy to find and access and for people of all ages and abilities. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable and you know you are in good hands from start to finish. This is one thing that is not to be missed.

Because I love medieval times this museum was exactly for me. Inside you find from oldest times old rome remains and many interesting works and exhibitions. Relative cheap but recomended bologna card to save more money.

Great medieval museum in Bologna. Free entrance for students.
The medieval connection is great, they speak a lot about the history of Bologna.
They also a modern installation, the Museum d'Ohm, where a permanent collection of objects is kept in a drawer (ask for the keys in reception).

Student friendly! Whole thing was free.

I visited during April. It was a nice experience to wander around and stare at art pieces or paintings for couple of hours. It fit pretty well for me as there were art and then some odd art pieces which made me mouth "what the ___k". I would not classify myself as a art museum go-er but I enjoyed this place.

I guess it can be fantastic if you enjoy this type of art. It’s free admission for students. Being your Uni-badge or have an email or some other kind of proof.
I love the places in which the staff can speak English.
Video Installations by Mika Rottenberg are more than mere experiences. They make you think about body, borders and senses.
Very mediocre. It was nice to do something a little more interesting in the city, but it's worth checking what is on before you go.

Wonderful contemporary art museum! well planned well staffed with a lovely place to have rest and coffee. Greatly enjoyed the temporary exhibition "That's IT". Definitely come by if you are in Bologna and interested in contemporary art!

Beautiful museum of music, where you can see instruments in a palazzo with frescoes. The place is gorgeous, with events worth watching out for. A must-see curiosity is Mozart's wrong test. He applied to the conservatory in Bologna, but got the test wrong. Realizing his genius, they let him take it again, and you can see the wrong one here.

A beautiful museum with a passionate staff. Museum is very informative and the staff is helpful and always willing to help museum goers with directions to exhibits or questions about the artifacts. If you love music history or history in general, I highly recommend! You learn a lot at this location! 😄
Beautiful place with grat history and amazing exhibition.

You may not know this, but a section is dedicated to padre martini, who was Mozart’s and Bach’s first born’s teacher.

There are a lot of amazing things to see including some stuff related to Mozart.
Incredible instruments and a wonderful staff. Maestro Tamminga frequently performs on the instruments in free, mini concerts. Highly recommend!

It is the best museum in Bologna. There are many interesting things about astronomy and its history. You should visit there. And the mandatory guide tour is also worth. Sara was a skilled guide and very good at history.

Great museum in Bologna, in the same building of Palazzo Poggi. You see the collections for about one hour in a guided tour, dedicated mostly to astronomy, and then check out the views to the city from the top of the tour.

7/6/16 Made appointment to view this museum and was greeted by a wonderful girl who led me on a one to one tour full of great exhibits complimented by the knowledge of my guide. The tour slowly climbs a tower,  which at the end opens up to give probably the best view of Bologna. The Specola is a must visit and I highly recommend you do.
Museo molto carino e reso ancora più interessante dalla ottima spiegazione della guida.

Da non perdere! Guidati da giovani studiosi preparati e appassionati, si sale sull'antica torre astronomica dell'Università fermandosi ad ogni piano per scoprire i tesori presenti, in un meraviglioso viaggio nella storia e tra le stelle: grandi telescopi riflettori e rifrattori, antiche mappe stellari, una meridiana tracciata sul pavimento, le prime macchine calcolatrici, un telescopio costruito dagli astronomi bolognesi nel 1750... E la grande invenzione di Guido Horn D'Arturo, lo specchio a tasselli degli anni '50, geniale soluzione che oggi è alla base di alcuni moderni giganteschi telescopi. Per finire, in cima alla torre vi aspetta un panorama mozzafiato.

Really cool place. Definitely worth checking out. I enjoyed it. It doesn't cost anything as they don't charge an entrance fee. I would recommend checking this museum and the others the University of Bologna has to offer.
Collezione impressionante per quantità e qualità, vista la settorialitā della materia consiglio di prenotare una visita guidata
Bellissimo e interessantissimo museo di mineralogia ad ingresso gratuito. Moltissimi sono i minerali esposti di diverso genere e provenienza in diverse zone d'italia e del mondo.

un piccolo museo molto bello e accurato nei dettagli. 
e nel piano centro storico di Bologna 
ingresso e totalmente gratuito
Una collezione splendida! Un ragazzo veramente appassionato ci ha anche fatto da guida. Un meraviglioso pomeriggio. Consigliatissimo.

Bellissimo museo e grandiosa collezione di esemplari.
Ingresso Gratis
Molto interessante, buone le guide.
Lovely City. Plenty of architecture to see and lots of good restaurants and coffee bars

Bologna's historic palace, it is an historic building which deserves a visit, especially to admire the paintings by Carracci. In short, it is a beautiful building which host sometimes as well other exhibitions
A must see in Bologna. The latest exhibition on a bolognese artist, Vacchi, was excellent!

This palazzo and its gallery on first floor are a real discovery! The building itself is beautiful - there's an art nouveau glass ceiling in the reception area and well perserved wooden ceiling on first floor. But the most amazing part are obviousely the breathtaking frescoes painted by Carracci.
Very interesting exhibition

Ancient church that now houses a collection of musical instruments. 
I went to the museum, which was a great visit, since it's a really beautiful place. They also have frequent evening concerts
Large array of harpsichords and pianos beautifully restored. Finding your way around can be difficult and the guards do not understand any English. Still very worthwhile.
A bit expensive for what it offers
Fantastic collection in a beautiful setting
Come here to see many spinetta piano
Beautiful architecture,  just to stand outside and stare at this building plus many others.

Bellissimo palazzo nel centro storico di Bologna in via Farini. Ampie stanze, molto belle e ben curate che ospitano mostre sempre interessanti. Attualmente è ospitata la mostra I vasi della vita - storia delle piante officinali. Molto bella oltre ai casi antichi nelle teche c'è un video illustrativo ed anche un attività didattica per riconoscere alcune piante officinali.
Molto interessante e bella
sede di mostre interessanti
Luogo storico sede di università  molto ben tenuto
Ci fanno i cori
Bellissima da visitare almeno una volta
Sede universitaria bellissima
L'ho visitata x caso. Sono andato x la laurea della fidanzata di mio figlio. Molto bella, risale al 1802 si trova a Bologna in piazzetta Giorgio Morandi.

Very disappointing. Difficult gaining entry through security gate. Very unfriendly welcome on entering the museum from the security guard such that I decided not to stay and go round the exhibition. The Museum needs to review how they deal with visitors, particularly those who do not speak Italian, current set up and staff will only deter visitors!
3 Euro entry, small museum, audio guide didn't work properly.  Bit disappointed
Not really a museum of international standards.  More of an information place.

The museum tells some interesting stories about the overall history of Judaism around the world, but it's mostly based on audiovisual material, and contains very little information about the local (Bologna) Jewish history. A few artifacts are displayed, but not enough to call this a "museum".
History of Jews in Bologna well covered
Fine art
Bellissima, suggestiva; un viaggio nell'arte di quasi duemila anni. Una chicca nascosta di Bologna da non perdere
Luogo di cultura cattolica. Posto unico nel suo genere

Merita veramente
Molto meglio di quanto pensassi.

Una raccolta molto interessante, ci sono diversi eventi formativi che vale la pena di seguire, in quanto a formazione è un luogo di eccellenza, che forse non sempre è valutato come meriterebbe. Consiglio di visitare il posto, meglio raggiungerlo in autobus, ad ogni modo in auto si riesce a trovare parcheggio (con un po' di pazienza)
Must see when visiting this area! So interesting! Take the factory tour.  We had a very knowledgeable tour guide. Well worth the $75pp entry fee. There are no photos permitted inside the factory.
Museo Lamborghini is a small but very nice museum right at Lamborghini HQ close to Bologna. A must visit not only for Lamborghini fans. The factory tour is highly recommendable

Amazing. Beautiful. Took the trip to the factory and I recommend it 100%. They show absolutely everything; you spend 50 minutrs inside the fabric where they pass you through the complete line of assembly of the cars. REALLY WORTH IT if you are a fan of Lamborghini!
Cool. Its just a hevan to me. Now my one misunderstand about lab is not more. Only lab is best. In the world.

Wonderful museum if you like Lamborghini. Who doesn't?! Two floors of cars and history, and right there at the site of manufacturing of models such as the Huracàn and Aventador. Spend the extra money to do the plant tour, well worth the experience to see how these amazing automobiles are meticulously crafted. Photos allowed in museum, but not during tour of factory.
Be careful at this park. I was just passing through and heard a lot of unpleasant words into my direction. There were weird guys with weird purposes.
This park is an oasis in this part of Bologna. Now it's early spring, lovely to sit here but I believe it will be wonderful in summertime.
Not very much to see or do. Relatively catered to
Cool parc and piazza with some farmers and cheap clothing

Warned by locals that this place is best to be avoided if you don’t want to be hassled by black dudes.  Like most places all over the world, the parks near railway and bus stations are no go zones esp at night and this one is no exception.

One of the best parks here in Bologna, you can walk up to bologna's hills from here and get the most amazing view of the city from up top. 
It's also possible to get to san luca sanctuary    by walking/bike , but it'll take some time (30 mins to an hour)
It has a great garden & big park & a museum. So pretty. It’s outside of center but easy to arrive with bus n 20 & definitely wirth a visit
This is a very nice and long park to go for a walk, esp. early in the morning.
Another beautiful Italian hidden garden
A splendid park to walk round
I went there with my friends to picnic. We were so lucky the weather was amazing. The view was beautiful close to the city.
It has a beautiful view but it's a bit far from center ...
Top

Per un meraviglioso tramonto e un ottimo aperipranzo o apericena non mancate di fermarvi alla baracchina e gustare un tagliere misto. Ottimi Affettati formaggi e verdure grigliate accompagnati da strepitose mini Crescentine fatte sul momento e da spicchi di piadina. Da non perdere!
È un parco. Con vista su Sasso Marconi. Senza bar.
Great venue, easy to find, well organised, intimate gig space.

Basically a tent in Parco Norte, in an ugly isolated area. Easy acces with bus 25 - we used Don Gnocchi stop (Google Maps recommendation), the walking directions were a little bit confusing - you'll have to turn imediatelly right (on the grass) after going down the bus (coming from the city center). Good management of the show, nice service on the desks for picking up the tickets for the Passenger show (we bought them online with Ticketmaster). The waiting time between the performance of the guy opening the show and the Mike's show was way too long - half an hour. The drinks provided were nice and not too expensive. The show was great, good sound etc. The crowd made the difference. :)
Great venue for gigs, if a little hard to get to. You'll probably want to get a taxi. Food truck outside does BEAST sandwiches.
Good place but it's difficult to reach it given it's place in Mordor :(
Beautifoul disco !!!
Small cozy place place just to drink wine and chat with your friends. Should get 5-stars if you are not obsessed with the wine glasses, which are very small to taste the wine properly.
Very affordable and genuine old-school feel. The crowd seems to vary between locals and international students.
Great place with cheap wine to scope out the local scene!! Loved the authentic atmosphere and pleasant people!
Here you have the opportunity to feel the original atmospheres from an old real Osteria. You bring your food and buy the wine.
Right in the heart of the food district. You can bring your own food and the wine...lovely and cheap. Love this place.
This little shop happy all sorts of delightful goodies including our favorite of pistachio biscotti and Viennesi chocolate covered hazelnut wader cookies.

Brilliant. It feels like Bologna 1960 inside, and the selection of Italian chocolates and sweets is so refined. A bit dear - it's very easy to spend hundreds of euros and leave with only a carrier bag, but so classy...
best shop ever

Nice and available staff here. Here you can also find many typical products of Bologna and Emilia Romagna. On Saturday they also do happy hour with €10 for first glass of wine and €5 for the second one.

The owner of the store seemed to be very welcoming and, since we were looking for aceto balsamico tradizionale di Modena, let us try various acetos with different years of storage. We decided to buy one, which we later learned wasn't even aceto balsamico, but some kind of cheap dressing based on aceto balsamico which is neither from Modena nor produced in the "tradizionale"-way. Maybe we should have checked twice, but the store owner recognised us as tourists and didn't say a word about our mistake. A huge let-down which makes us come to the conclusion, that he intentionally fooled us into buying a dressing for about 36€, that can be bought for 14€ on the internet.

Great Saturday Lunch! The place was crowded for lunch on Saturday, but the staff were very helpful and spoke English well. I think we were the only non-Italians in the restaurant.  Both lasagne and tagliatelle al ragu were the best we've had in Bologna! Great wine selection by our waiter and the  mascarpone and chocolate mousse were very good!
Very nice, friendly staff and authentic food
Excellent service and food. Extensive wine list. Friendly staff.
Food and house-wine are average. The waiter was rude at the beginning but then very polite suddenly.
If you like leftovers re-heated in the microwave, this is the perfect restaurant for you. By far my worst experience in Bologna.
This is a fine typical Bolognese restaurant. So authentic food and very good. Monday's it is closed

Great service,  but highly over priced at 97€. 
We had 2 starters, 2 meat dishes, 1 plate of fruit, 1 large beer and an espresso. My main at 18€ of thinly sliced cold roast beef with nothing on the side, didn’t warrant the price. I left hungry and highly disappointed. 
The restaurant also had damp smell to it.

I was there some 8 years ago and loved the traditional food. The service even then was a little abrupt and that hasn't changed (despite me trying hard with my basic Italian). We were there for a short lunch, It's ok but you can find a friendlier experience of traditional food else where especially for the prices. Our lasagne was exceptional, but sadly I don't think I'd recommend Diana over some other places we've been recommended over the last week.
Tipical ,old traditional Italian restaurant! Very good.
A very good restaurant in Bologna, the services are good and waiters are very nice.
A nice cozy cafe with wifi - good to drop by for an hour or so with computer. You can also take breakfast and lunch here.
Consistent fresh, good quality!
One of the best coffees in Bologna! It's also possible to have breakfast and lunch here, with good prices, traditional food and good service.

Oggi abbiamo festeggiato la laurea di nostro figlio in questo locale.Siamo arrivati in un bel gruppetto di persone all'improvviso,ma la titolare con l'aiuto dei suoi collaboratori ci ha allestito un lungo tavolo e poi ci ha servito un ricco buffet di cibo salato,pasticcini,drink e spumante.Ottimo tutto quanto e ho gradito molto la loro cortesia.Consiglio il posto per la qualita e il prezzo.

Paste e pasticcini freschi e meravigliosi.
Una colazione da sogno mette di buon umore per tutta la giornata.

Proper local food. Very little English but enough to order the food. Tortellini is a must! Everything cooked to perfection. The ox cheek melted in our mouth. So soft and yummy. We definitely enjoyed it
Great place to eat in bologna. I was there for a week and went to Tony's twice! Local food with wonderful staff, very cozy. You should make reservation before.

We really enjoyed this place. The owner seats you and brings the bill. My wife had the lasagna and I had the ragu. No complaints at all.  A half carafe of wine and the meal was $33euro. Very reasonable for fresh made pasta. Hey Americans, slow down and enjoy your meal. This isn't the U.S.
The best lasagna I ever had but I am not so experienced. The tagliatelle a ragu were amazing too. I would recommend totally for people to have want to loose their Italian cuisine virginity.
Great food. Great service. Good price. We ate dinner. Tasty dishes.
One of the best meals I've had ever!!
Nice and very accommodating staffs.
Had a lovely lunch of rabbit, risotto, and tortellini

Very wonderful experience. We were just wandering the streets looking for a place to eat. It was close to closing time but they graciously accepted us and made us feel at home. Thank you for such a nice evening.
Nice and cost little place! Good choice of drinks and cocktails. Friendly prices as well.
I love this restaurant. excellent and super taste. wow

Love it!! Great fresh food! Beautyful people 
Great limocelli!!!
Great local food, cosy atmosphere

Pizzeria e Ristorante con cucina tradizionale. Il personale è cortese e alla mano e il servizio é veloce. Menù vario con proposta "del giorno" per il pranzo a un prezzo conveniente. Porzioni abbondanti ma la qualità della cucina é scarsa. Da provare però la pizza con impasto al carbone. Accettano pagamento con carta di credito, bancomat, buoni pasto e contante.

Mi sono trovato molto bene. Personale professionale e cordiale. Il locale e a due passi dal centro è molto caldo e accogliente. Ottimi piatti tipici bolognesi con pasta fatta a mano. Fanno anche la pizza. Può competere tranquillamente con le osterie storiche. Prezzi nella media.
